newsitem.title: USA: Shell Mars crude, natgas resumes operations.
newsitem.headline: Shell Mars crude, natgas resumes operations.

text.p: Shell Oil said Thursday crude oil and natural gas production in the Gulf of Mexico had resumed normal operations.
"Mars is back up. I got word this morning it's now running at full capacity," a company spokeswoman said.

Mars crude output, at 25,000 barrels per day (bpd) and natural gas at roughly 26 million cubic feet per day (mmcfd), was disrupted over the weekend by Josephine, a tropical storm which swept through the Gulf of Mexico into Florida.
The start-up of production was delayed because Shell conducted some minor repairs to installations.
Domestic sour crudes have gained since U.S. Gulf producers suffered drops in crude production from the storm.
